question: Do tumor cells activate Notch signaling in neighboring stromal endothelial cells via ligands such as Jagged1? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Here, we report that the Notch ligand Jagged1 induced by growth factors via mitogen-activating protein kinase (MAPK) in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) cells triggered Notch activation in neighboring endothelial cells (ECs) and promoted capillary-like sprout formation.
content.source_2: Contrary to expectations, co-cultures of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma cells with endothelial cells did not exhibit Notch-dependent angiogenic responses; MAPK inhibition abrogated Jagged1 upregulation in the tumor cells without inducing Notch target gene expression in neighboring ECs, indicating that tumorâ€“stromal Notch signaling was not operative.
content.source_3: We recently demonstrated that Notch signaling is involved in proliferation and survival of B cell-derived tumor cells of classic Hodgkin disease, but the pathway functioned autonomously within the malignant population, with no detectable activation in surrounding stromal cells or endothelial compartments.
